fields.description: A term to describe the content of the image by a value from a controlled vocabulary.
fields.comments: Controlled vocabulary of subjects to support broad classification of media items. Terms from various controlled vocabularies may be used. AC-recommended vocabularies are preferred and MAY be unqualified literals (not a full URI). For terms from other vocabularies either a precise URI SHOULD be used, or, as long as all unqualified terms in all vocabularies are unique, metadata SHOULD provide the source vocabularies using the Subject Category Vocabulary term. The value SHOULD be a string, whose text can also be in the form of a URL. These guidelines on value format are less restrictive than is specified by the IPTC guidelines.

fields.name: mediaSubjectCategoryIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the subject category of the Media instance.

fields.name: mediaSubjectCategoryVocabulary
fields.description: Any vocabulary or formal classification from which terms in the Subject Category have been drawn.
fields.comments: The AC recommended vocabularies do not need to be cited here. There is no required linkage between individual Subject Category terms and the vocabulary; the mechanism is intended to support discovery of the normative URI for a term, but not guarantee it.

fields.name: geologicalContextID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:GeologicalContext.

fields.name: eventID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: earliestEonOrLowestEonothem
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ('Precambrian') attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestEonOrHighestEonothem
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ('Precambrian') attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestEraOrLowestErathem
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestEraOrHighestErathem
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestPeriodOrHighestSystem
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestEpochOrLowestSeries
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestEpochOrHighestSeries
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestAgeOrLowestStage
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestAgeOrHighestStage
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: lowestBiostratigraphicZone
fields.description: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: highestBiostratigraphicZone
fields.description: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: lithostratigraphicTerms
fields.description: The combination of all litho-stratigraphic names for the rock from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: group
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: formation
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: member
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: bed
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.description: An identifier for an Agent.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: agentRole

fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary for the roles appropriate to the class of resource an AgentRole is related to.

fields.name: agentRoleIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the role of an Agent.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: agentRoleVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definition of the value for agentRole is given.

fields.name: agentRoleOrder
fields.description: The numerical position of an AgentRole in a set of AgentRoles that have the same combination of agentRole, agentRoleIRI, agentRoleVocabulary and related target.
fields.comments: One could use agentRoleOrder to create an ordered list of collectors (agentRole = 'collector') for a dwc:MaterialEntity, for example. The first would have agentRoleOrder=1, the second would have agentRoleOrder=2.

fields.name: agentRoleDate
fields.description: The interval during which an AgentRole was in effect.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: identificationID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: taxonID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: taxonOrder
fields.description: The position of a dwc:Taxon in a taxonFormula.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which a dwc:scientificName is classified.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in dwc:verbatimIdentification.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Roptrocerus typographi (Györfi, 1952)` (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in a dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: taxonRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Taxon.
fields.examples: `This name is a misspelling in common use.`

fields.name: identificationID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: basedOnOccurrenceID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence based on which a dwc:Identification was made.

fields.name: basedOnMaterialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity based on which a dwc:Identification was made.

fields.name: basedOnNucleotideSequenceID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideSequence based on which a dwc:Identification was made.

fields.name: basedOnNucleotideAnalysisID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideAnalysis based on which a dwc:Identification was made.

fields.name: basedOnMediaID
fields.description: An identifier for a Media instance based on which a dwc:Identification was made.

fields.name: identificationType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.description: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.
fields.examples: `Ctenomys sociabilis`; `social tuco-tuco`; `Peromyscus sp.`; `Ministrymon sp. nov. 1`; `Anser anser × Branta canadensis`; `Pachyporidae?`

fields.name: isAcceptedIdentification
fields.description: The dwc:Identification of a dwc:Organism is a currently accepted one.

fields.name: taxonFormula
fields.description: A string representing the pattern to use to construct a dwc:Identification from dwc:Taxon names and identification qualifiers.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as https://arctos.database.museum/info/ctDocumentation.cfm?table=cttaxa_formula.
fields.examples: `A`; `A ?`; `A or B`; `A and B`; `A x B`; `A cf.`; `A aff.`

fields.name: typeStatus
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `holotype of Ctenomys sociabilis. Pearson O. P., and M. I. Christie. 1985. Historia Natural, 5(37):388`; `holotype of Pinus abies | holotype of Picea abies`

fields.name: typeDesignationType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a type designation.
fields.comments: From https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/typesandspecimen.xml.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI, metabarcoding reference database) used in a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.` ; `UNITE v10.0, https://doi.org/10.15156/BIO/3301231`

fields.name: taxonAssignmentMethod
fields.description: Tool and thresholds used to compare sequences when computing 'species-level' OTUs

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD.

fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Identification.

fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: assertionType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of an Assertion.
fields.examples: `mass`; `mean mass`; `weight standard deviation`; `minimum organism quantity`; `water temperature`; `salinity`

fields.name: assertionTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: assertionTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in assertionType is given.

fields.name: assertionMadeDate
fields.description: The date on which an Assertion was created.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: assertionEffectiveDate
fields.description: The date on which the state or measurement of an Assertion was deemed to first be in effect.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: assertionValue
fields.description: An asserted value, if it is not numeric.

fields.name: assertionValueIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the value of an Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: assertionValueVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in assertionValue is given.

fields.name: assertionValueNumeric
fields.description: An asserted value, if it is numeric.

fields.name: assertionUnit
fields.description: The units associated with the value in assertionValueNumeric.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Ontology of Units of Measure http://www.wurvoc.org/vocabularies/om-1.8/ of SI units, derived units, or other non-SI units accepted for use within the SI. For units that are composed of multiple parts, use the patterns as given in "A Primer for Communicating Mathematics via Plain Text" (https://cse.sc.edu/~fenner/latex-ASCII.pdf) by Stephen Fenner (e.g., `g/cm^3` for grams per cubic centimeter). For other units, provide the value as a recognizable standard (e.g., '%') or written out in full and in the plural (e.g., `individuals`). It is fine to provide non-SI units in the original language of the dataset.

fields.name: assertionUnitIRI
fields.description: The IRI for the units of an assertionValueNumeric.

fields.name: assertionUnitVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in assertionUnit is given.

fields.name: assertionBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made an Assertion.
fields.examples: `José E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson`; `FMNH`

fields.name: assertionByID
fields.description: An identifier for an Agent who made an Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)

fields.name: assertionProtocol
fields.description: The names of, references to, or descriptions of the methods or protocols used in making an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionProtocolID
fields.description: An identifier for a Protocol used to make an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with an Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: assertionRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about an Assertion.

fields.name: citationID
fields.description: An identifier for a Citation.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: citationType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a Citation.

fields.name: citationTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Citation.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: citationTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in citationType is given.

fields.name: bibliographicCitation
fields.description: A bibliographic reference for the resource.
fields.comments: From Dublin Core, 'Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.' The intended usage of this term in Darwin Core is to provide the preferred way to cite the resource itself. Note that the intended usage of dcterms:references in Darwin Core, by contrast, is to point to the definitive source representation of the resource, if one is available.
fields.examples: `Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, UC Berkeley. MVZ Mammal Collection (Arctos). Record ID: http://arctos.database.museum/guid/MVZ:Mamm:165861?seid=101356. Source: http://ipt.vertnet.org:8080/ipt/resource.do?r=mvz_mammal.` (Occurrence example); `https://www.gbif.org/species/2439608 Source: GBIF Taxonomic Backbone` (Taxon example); `Rand, K.M., Logerwell, E.A. The first demersal trawl survey of benthic fish and invertebrates in the Beaufort Sea since the late 1970s. Polar Biol 34, 475–488 (2011). https://doi.org/10.1007/s00300-010-0900-2` (Event example)

fields.name: pageNumber
fields.description: The number of the page on which the citation occurs in the cited reference.
fields.comments: From Dublin Core, 'Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.' The intended usage of this term in Darwin Core is to provide the preferred way to cite the resource itself. Note that the intended usage of dcterms:references in Darwin Core, by contrast, is to point to the definitive source representation of the resource, if one is available.

fields.name: referenceID
fields.description: An identifier for the reference in which a Citation occurs.

fields.name: referenceType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a reference.

fields.name: referenceTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of reference.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: referenceTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in referenceType is given.

fields.name: referenceYear
fields.description: The year the reference in a Citation was published.

fields.name: isPeerReviewed
fields.description: An indication of whether the reference for a Citation was peer reviewed.

fields.name: citationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a Citation.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: An unambiguous reference to a resource within a given context.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to identify a resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: identifierType
fields.description: The category or system that best matches the nature of an Identifier.

fields.name: identifierTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Identifier.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: identifierTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in identifierType is given.

fields.name: identifierLanguage
fields.description: A language in which an Identifier is presented.
fields.comments: Recommended best prectice is to use an ISO639-2 three-letter language code.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.description: An identifier for a Media instance.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: mediaSubjectCategory
fields.description: A term to describe the content of the image by a value from a controlled vocabulary.
fields.comments: Controlled vocabulary of subjects to support broad classification of media items. Terms from various controlled vocabularies may be used. AC-recommended vocabularies are preferred and MAY be unqualified literals (not a full URI). For terms from other vocabularies either a precise URI SHOULD be used, or, as long as all unqualified terms in all vocabularies are unique, metadata SHOULD provide the source vocabularies using the Subject Category Vocabulary term. The value SHOULD be a string, whose text can also be in the form of a URL. These guidelines on value format are less restrictive than is specified by the IPTC guidelines.

fields.name: mediaSubjectCategoryIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the subject category of the Media instance.

fields.name: mediaSubjectCategoryVocabulary
fields.description: Any vocabulary or formal classification from which terms in the Subject Category have been drawn.
fields.comments: The AC recommended vocabularies do not need to be cited here. There is no required linkage between individual Subject Category terms and the vocabulary; the mechanism is intended to support discovery of the normative URI for a term, but not guarantee it.

fields.name: protocolID
fields.description: An identifier for a Protocol.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: eventID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: materialCategory
fields.description: The broad category that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a limited, tightly controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: materialEntityType
fields.description: The narrow category that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `whole organism`; `heart`; `liver tissue sample`; `fossil`; `germplasm`; `skull`; `cast`; `3D printed model`; `printed photograph`

fields.name: institutionCode
fields.description: The name (or acronym) in use by an institution.

fields.name: institutionID
fields.description: An identifier for an institution.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: ownerInstitutionCode
fields.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: ownerInstitutionID
fields.description: An identifier for an institution that owns a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: collectionCode
fields.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying a Collection.

fields.name: collectionID
fields.description: An identifier for a Collection.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: catalogNumber
fields.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for a dwc:MaterialEntity within a Collection.

fields.name: otherCatalogNumbers
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same dwc:MaterialEntity, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: collectedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for collecting a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.examples: `José E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson`; `FMNH`

fields.name: collectedByID
fields.description: An identifier for the Agent responsible for collecting a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: objectCount
fields.description: The number of distinct objects comprising a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: recordNumber
fields.description: An identifier given to a dwc:MaterialEntity at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and a dwc:MaterialEntity, such as a specimen collector's number.

fields.name: preparations
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: disposition
fields.description: The current state of a dwc:MaterialEntity with respect to where it can be found.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: verbatimLabel
fields.description: The content of this term should include no embellishments, prefixes, headers or other additions made to the text. Abbreviations must not be expanded and supposed misspellings must not be corrected. Lines or breakpoints between blocks of text that could be verified by seeing the original labels or images of them may be used. Examples of material entities include preserved specimens, fossil specimens, and material samples. Best practice is to use UTF-8 for all characters. Best practice is to add comment “verbatimLabel derived from human transcription” in dwc:occurrenceRemarks.
fields.comments: Examples can be found at https://dwc.tdwg.org/examples/verbatimLabel.

fields.name: associatedSequences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: materialCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: informationWithheld
fields.description: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.
fields.examples: `location information not given for endangered species`; `collector identities withheld | ask about tissue samples`

fields.name: dataGeneralizations
fields.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
fields.examples: `coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell`

fields.name: materialEntityRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.examples: `found in association with charred remains`; `some original fragments missing`

fields.name: evidenceForOccurrenceID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence for which a dwc:MaterialEntity provides evidence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: derivedFromMaterialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity from which this dwc:MaterialEntity was derived.

fields.name: derivationEventID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event during which a dwc:MaterialEntity was derived from another dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: derivationType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of the derivation of a dwc:MaterialEntity from a dwc:MaterialEntity pointed to by derivedFromMaterialEntityID.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: partOfMaterialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity of which this dwc:MaterialEntity is a part.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.description: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.
fields.examples: `Ctenomys sociabilis`; `social tuco-tuco`; `Peromyscus sp.`; `Ministrymon sp. nov. 1`; `Anser anser × Branta canadensis`; `Pachyporidae?`

fields.name: taxonFormula
fields.description: A string representing the pattern to use to construct a dwc:Identification from dwc:Taxon names and identification qualifiers.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as https://arctos.database.museum/info/ctDocumentation.cfm?table=cttaxa_formula.
fields.examples: `A`; `A ?`; `A or B`; `A and B`; `A x B`; `A cf.`; `A aff.`

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic determination has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD.

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the uñas.`

fields.name: taxonID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which a dwc:scientificName is classified.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in dwc:verbatimIdentification.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Roptrocerus typographi (Györfi, 1952)` (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in a dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: taxonRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Taxon.
fields.examples: `This name is a misspelling in common use.`

fields.name: agentID
fields.description: An identifier for an Agent.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.description: An identifier for a Media instance.

fields.name: agentRole
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a role of an Agent.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary for the roles appropriate to the class of resource an AgentRole is related to.

fields.name: agentRoleIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the role of an Agent.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: agentRoleVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definition of the value for agentRole is given.

fields.name: agentRoleOrder
fields.description: The numerical position of an AgentRole in a set of AgentRoles that have the same combination of agentRole, agentRoleIRI, agentRoleVocabulary and related target.
fields.comments: One could use agentRoleOrder to create an ordered list of collectors (agentRole = 'collector') for a dwc:MaterialEntity, for example. The first would have agentRoleOrder=1, the second would have agentRoleOrder=2.

fields.name: agentRoleDate
fields.description: The interval during which an AgentRole was in effect.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: assertionID
fields.description: An identifier for an Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.description: An identifier for a Media instance.

fields.name: assertionType

fields.name: assertionTypeIRI

fields.name: assertionTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in assertionType is given.

fields.name: assertionMadeDate
fields.description: The date on which an Assertion was created.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: assertionEffectiveDate
fields.description: The date on which the state or measurement of an Assertion was deemed to first be in effect.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: assertionValue
fields.description: An asserted value, if it is not numeric.

fields.name: assertionValueIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the value of an Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: assertionValueVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in assertionValue is given.

fields.name: assertionValueNumeric
fields.description: An asserted value, if it is numeric.

fields.name: assertionUnit
fields.description: The units associated with the value in assertionValueNumeric.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Ontology of Units of Measure http://www.wurvoc.org/vocabularies/om-1.8/ of SI units, derived units, or other non-SI units accepted for use within the SI. For units that are composed of multiple parts, use the patterns as given in "A Primer for Communicating Mathematics via Plain Text" (https://cse.sc.edu/~fenner/latex-ASCII.pdf) by Stephen Fenner (e.g., `g/cm^3` for grams per cubic centimeter). For other units, provide the value as a recognizable standard (e.g., '%') or written out in full and in the plural (e.g., `individuals`). It is fine to provide non-SI units in the original language of the dataset.

fields.name: assertionUnitIRI
fields.description: The IRI for the units of an assertionValueNumeric.

fields.name: assertionUnitVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary in which the definition of the value in assertionUnit is given.

fields.name: assertionBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made an Assertion.
fields.examples: `José E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson`; `FMNH`

fields.name: assertionByID
fields.description: An identifier for an Agent who made an Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)

fields.name: assertionProtocolID
fields.description: An identifier for a Protocol used to make an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionCitation

fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to identify a resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.
